exam_details.name: JEE Main
exam_details.instructions:
1. Total duration of this test is 180 minutes.
  2. There will be 90 Single Option Correct MCQ questions.
  3. There are 3 sections in the question paper consisting of Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, having 30 (Physics), 30 (Chemistry), 30 (Mathematics) questions respectively.
  4. Each question is allotted 4 (Four) marks for correct response.
  5. 1 (One) mark will be deducted for indicating incorrect response for each question.
  6. No deduction from the total score will be made if no response is indicated.
  7. To activate RankUp - Guaranteed improvement plan, you must spend atleast 30% of the time allocated to the test.
  8. Please use ONE device, browser and tab while taking this test. As an anti-cheating measure, switching between tabs, browsers or devices will result in loss of your test data.
  9. To get access to your Advanced Test Feedback, ensure that you have:
    • spent at least 10% of the total test time and
    • attempted 10% of the total number of questions in the test.

questions.question: In an LCR circuit as shown below both switches are open initially. Now switch S 1 is closed, S 2 kept open. ( q is charge on the capacitor and τ = RC  is capacitive time constant). Which of the following statement is correct?

options.option: Work done by the battery is half of the energy dissipated in the resistor

questions.question: A diode detector is used to detect an amplitude modulated wave of 60% modulation  by using a condenser of capacity 250 pico farad in parallel with a load resistance of  100 kilo ohm. Find the maximum modulated frequency which could be detected by it.

The supply voltage to room is <math> <mrow> <mtext>120 V</mtext> </mrow> </math>. The resistance of the lead wires is <math> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <mi> Ω</mi> </mrow> </math>. A <math> <mrow> <mtext>60 W</mtext> </mrow> </math> bulb is already switched on. What is the decrease of voltage across the bulb, when a <math> <mrow> <mtext>240 W</mtext> </mrow> </math> heater is switched on in parallel to the bulb?

A uniform cylinder of length L and mass M having cross-sectional area A is suspended, with its length vertical, from a fixed point by a massless spring, such that it is half submerged in a liquid of density σ at equilibrium position. The extension x 0 of the spring when it is in equilibrium is (Here k is spring constant):

A beam of unpolarised light of intensity <math> <mrow> <msub> <mtext>I</mtext> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mrow> </math> is passed through a polaroid <math> <mrow> <mtext>A</mtext> </mrow> </math> and then through another polaroid <math> <mrow> <mtext>B</mtext> </mrow> </math> which is oriented so that its principal plane makes an angle of <math> <mrow> <msup> <mtext>45</mtext> <mtext>o</mtext> </msup> </mrow> </math> relative to that of <math> <mrow> <mtext>A</mtext> </mrow> </math>. The intensity of the emergent light is:

questions.question: The above  p - v diagram represents the thermodynamic cycle of an engine, operating with an ideal monoatomic gas. The amount of heat, extracted from the source in a single cycle is:

A sonometer wire of length <math> <mrow> <mtext>1.5 m</mtext> </mrow> </math> is made of steel. The tension in it produces an elastic strain of <math> <mrow> <mtext>1%</mtext> </mrow> </math>. What is the fundamental frequency of steel if density and elasticity of steel are <math> <mrow> <mtext>7.7</mtext> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <msup> <mn>0</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mtext> kg</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <msup> <mtext>m</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mtext>2.2</mtext> <mo>×</mo> <mn>1</mn> <msup> <mn>0</mn> <mn>11</mn> </msup> <mtext> N</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <msup> <mtext>m</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </math> respectively?

This question has Statement I and Statement II. Of the four choices given after the Statements, choose the one that best describes the two Statements.

Statement - I : Higher the range, greater is the resistance of ammeter.
Statement - II : To increase the range of ammeter, additional shunt needs to be used across it.

options.option: Statement-<math><mrow><mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math><mrow><mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is false.
Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is false, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is true.

Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is the correct explanation of Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math>.

Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is not the correct explanation of Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math>.

questions.question: What is the minimum energy required to launch a satellite of mass <math> <mrow> <mtext>m</mtext> </mrow> </math> from the surface of a planet of mass <math> <mrow> <mtext>M</mtext> </mrow> </math> and radius <math> <mrow> <mtext>R</mtext> </mrow> </math> in a circular orbit at an altitude of <math> <mrow> <mtext>2R</mtext> </mrow> </math>?

A projectile is given an initial velocity of <math> <mrow> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>i</mtext> <mo>^</mo> </mover> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>j</mtext> <mo>^</mo> </mover> </mrow> </mfenced> <mtext>m</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mtext>s</mtext> </mrow> </math>, where <math> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>i</mtext> <mo>^</mo> </mover> </mrow> </math> is along the ground and <math> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>j</mtext> <mo>^</mo> </mover> </mrow> </math> is along the vertical . If <math> <mrow> <mtext>g</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>10 m</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <msup> <mtext>s</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </math>, the equation of its trajectory is :

The initial velocity of the centre of the hoop is zero. What will be the velocity of the centre of the hoop when it ceases to slip?

The piston and the cylinder have equal cross sectional area <math> <mrow> <mtext>A</mtext> </mrow> </math>. The piston is slightly displaced from the equilibrium position and released. Assuming that the system is completely isolated from its surrounding, the piston executes a simple harmonic motion with frequency :

The distance between their centres is 15 cm. If a current of 2.0 A flows through the smaller loop, then the flux linked with bigger loop is:

This question has Statement I: and Statement II: . Of the four choices given after the statements, choose the one that best describes the two statements.

Statement I: A point particle of mass m moving with speed ν collides with stationary point particle of mass M . If the maximum energy loss possible is given as
f 1 2 m ν 2 then f = m M + m .

Statement II: : Maximum energy loss occurs when the particles get stuck together as a result of the collision.

options.option: Statement-<math><mrow><mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math><mrow><mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is false.
Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is false, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is true.

Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is a correct explanation of Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math>.

Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is true, Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>II</mo> </mrow> </math> is not a correct explanation of Statement-<math> <mrow> <mo>I</mo> </mrow> </math>.

questions.question:
Given : A circle, 2 x 2 + 2 y 2 = 5  and a parabola, y 2 = 4 5 x .

Statement - I : An equation of a common tangent to these curves is y = x + 5 .

Statement - II : If the line, y = mx + 5 m  m ≠ 0   is their common tangent, then m satisfies m4-3m2+2=0.

options.option: Statement - I is true; Statement - II is false.
Statement - I is false; Statement - II is true.
Statement - I true; Statement - II is true; Statement - II is a correct explanation for statement - I.
Statement - I is true; Statement - II is true; Statement - II is not a correct explanation for statement - I.
